name: The Fool
upright: Exile the top card of each player's deck face-up. You may place one of those cards. ("Each player's deck" includes yours.)
reversed: Deal 5 damage to each player. (Including you.)

name: The Magician
upright: Place a card. You may reverse this card.
reversed: Draw 3 cards, then discard 3 cards. If you cannot do either, you win the game.

name: The High Priestess
upright: Name a card. Choose a player to reveal cards from their deck until they reveal the named card. If they do, put the revealed cards in their memory. Otherwise, that player shuffles.
reversed: Place any number of cards face-down. You may replace this card. (If you do, dismiss this card. Face-down cards may be flipped face-up and triggered at any time.)

name: The Empress
upright: If The Emperor is on your spread, you win the game.
reversed: You may name a card. If the named card is in any player's memory, you may place it, then silence it. If you place a card this way, reverse this card.

name: The Emperor
upright: If The Empress is on your spread, you win the game.
reversed: You may dismiss all other cards on your spread to take 2 cards from any players' spreads, silence them, then reverse this card.

name: The Hierophant
upright: Choose a suit. Exile all cards not of that suit. (The suits are Pentacles, Swords, Cups, and Wands. Major cards have no suit. Exile them as well.)
reversed: Dismiss all Major cards. For each card dismissed this way, its player may place a Minor card from their hand to that position.

name: The Lovers
upright: Each player draws 2 cards or gains 5 life. (They choose.)
reversed: Each opponent discards a card. If they cannot, they take 3 damage.

name: The Chariot
upright: Take a card and put it on your spread. (You may reverse it. You cannot replace Major cards this way.)
reversed: Exile all cards from a player's memory.

name: Strength
upright: Deal damage to an opponent equal to half their life rounded down, and you take that much damage. This cannot reduce your life total to less than 1.
reversed: Pay any number of life up to 10. Deal that much damage to each opponent. (Life paid this way is not damage.)

name: The Hermit
upright: You may dismiss this card to reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Major card. You may replace this card with that card. If you do not, draw it. Shuffle your deck.
reversed: Each player chooses up to 2 cards. Dismiss all other cards.

name: The Wheel of Fortune
upright: Flip a coin. If you win, you gain 3 life and flip again. Repeat until you lose a flip.
reversed: Choose an opponent. Flip a coin. The loser of the flip loses 2 life to a minimum of 1 life. The winner may flip again. If they do, double the amount of life lost each time.

name: Justice
upright: The player with the least life gains 5 life, then deal 5 damage to the player with the most life. (If there is a tie, you choose.)
reversed: The player with the greatest life gains 5 life. Deal 5 damage to the player with the least life. (If there is a tie, you choose.)

name: The Hanged Man
upright: Dismiss any number of cards on your spread. On this turn, whenever you place a card, you may place one additional card for each card dismissed this way.
reversed: The next time a player's life total would be reduced to less than 1, it is reduced to 1 instead.

name: Death
upright: Place up to 3 cards. Deal damage to a player equal to 5 minus the number of cards placed.
reversed: Dismiss up to 3 cards on your spread. Deal 5 damage to a player for each card you dismiss this way.

name: Temperance
upright: Choose a player with the lowest life total. Each player's life total becomes equal to that player's life total. (Life lost this way is not damage.)
reversed: If you have the lowest life total among all players, increase your life total to the lowest life total among all other players.

name: The Devil
upright: Deal 3 damage to each opponent. You gain 1 life for each opponent damaged this way.
reversed: Exile all cards on your spread. For the rest of the game, whenever you would place a card, you may pay 2 life to place a card from your memory instead.

name: The Tower
upright: Exile this card. Shuffle all cards into their players' libraries. Starting with you, each player places 2 cards and cannot replace cards this way.
reversed: Exile this card, place a card, then flip all cards face-down.

name: The Star
upright: Gain 2 life. If you have at least 10 more life than each opponent, you win the game.
reversed: Deal 2 damage to each player, then deal damage to each opponent equal to the damage they have taken this turn. ("All players" includes you.)

name: The Moon
upright: Return all other cards to their players' hands, then exile this card. Until the end of your next turn, players place cards face-down.
reversed: Each opponent moves a number of cards equal to the number of cards on their spread plus the number of cards in their hand from their deck to their memory.

name: The Sun
upright: If you have fewer than 5 cards in hand, you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in hand. (You may draw to less than 5.)
reversed: Deal damage to each player equal to the number of cards in their hand. ("Each player" includes you.)

name: Judgement
upright: Dismiss all cards. For each card on an opponent's spread dismissed this way, deal 2 damage to that player. ("All cards" includes this card.)
reversed: Dismiss this card. Place up to 3 cards.

name: The World
upright: Put a counter on The World, then deal damage to each opponent equal to the number of counters on The World.
reversed: Put 7 counters on The World. If there are 21 or more counters on The World, reverse it.

name: Ace of Pentacles
upright: Take 2 damage. The next time you place a card, draw two.
reversed: Dismiss a non-Wand, non-Pentacle card. (Major cards have no suit.)

name: 2 of Pentacles
upright: Deal damage to a player equal to the number of cards in their hand.
reversed: Exchange the positions of two cards. If both cards are on spreads other than yours, draw a card. (You may reverse cards when you exchange them.)

name: 3 of Pentacles
upright: Choose a player to reveal their hand. Choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
reversed: Deal damage to each player equal to 5 minus the number of cards they have in hand. ("Each player" includes you. Damage cannot be negative.)

name: 4 of Pentacles
upright: Dismiss this card. Take a card and put it on your spread. At the end of your next turn, dismiss that card.
reversed: Deal 2 damage to any number of players, then those players each draw a card.

name: 5 of Pentacles
upright: Each opponent with a Major card or a Swords card on their spread discards a card.
reversed: If you have fewer than 2 cards in hand, draw until you have 2 cards in hand.

name: 6 of Pentacles
upright: Gain life equal to the number of cards you have in hand.
reversed: Each opponent may give you a card from their hand. If they do not, they take 3 damage.

name: 7 of Pentacles
upright: Put a counter on this card. You may dismiss this card. If you do, your life total becomes equal to 7 times the number of counters on this card.
reversed: Choose a player. That player discards their hand, then draws that many cards minus 1. (This number cannot be negative.)

name: 8 of Pentacles
upright: Copy an effect of a card on another player's spread. (You may choose either effect on the card.)
reversed: You may reveal a Major card or Pentacles card from your hand. If you do, place it.

name: 9 of Pentacles
upright: Until the end of this turn, whenever you place a card, you may draw a card.
reversed: Return any number of cards from your memory to your hand. Take damage equal to the number of cards returned.

name: 10 of Pentacles
upright: Place a card from your memory.
reversed: Exile up to three cards from a player's memory.

name: Page of Pentacles
upright: Reveal any number of cards from your hand. For each Pentacles card you revealed plus each Pentacles card on your spread, deal 2 damage to a player and gain 1 life.
reversed: Exile up to three cards from your memory. Deal 1 damage to a player for each card exiled this way.

name: Knight of Pentacles
upright: You may place a card in your Future position. You may exchange its position with another card on your spread. (You may reverse cards when you exchange them.)
reversed: Silence all cards in the same zone as this one. (Including this card and those on other players' spreads.)

name: Queen of Pentacles
upright: Move 3 cards from your deck to your memory. The next time you would place a card, you may place a card from your memory instead.
reversed: Deal 2 damage to a player, then gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

name: King of Pentacles
upright: Dismiss all Major cards, then dismiss this card. For each card dismissed this way, its player may draw a card.
reversed: Dismiss all Minor cards. For each card dismissed this way, its player may draw a card. ("All cards" includes this card.)

name: Ace of Swords
upright: Choose Wands, Cups, or Swords. For each card of the chosen suit, deal 2 damage to its player. (Including cards on your spread.)
reversed: Dismiss a card. Its player may place another card in its place.

name: 2 of Swords
upright: Choose a player to exchange the positions of any cards on their spread. (Players may reverse cards when they exchange their positions.)
reversed: Reverse all cards. (Including this card, rotate them 180 degrees.)

name: 3 of Swords
upright: Silence a card. (The next time it would trigger, it does not.)
reversed: Prevent the next instance of damage you would take.

name: 4 of Swords
upright: Exchange a card on your spread with a card on another player's spread. (You may reverse those cards.)
reversed: Deal 3 damage to the player with the most life. (In the event of a tie, you choose which player.)

name: 5 of Swords
upright: Dismiss this card, then dismiss any other card.
reversed: Choose another player. You and that player each draw a card.

name: 6 of Swords
upright: Dismiss a Wand.
reversed: Name a card. Cards with the chosen name cannot be dismissed until your next turn.

name: 7 of Swords
upright: Dismiss this card, then take any card and place it in this card’s position. (You may reverse it. It does not trigger.)
reversed: Reverse a card.

name: 8 of Swords
upright: Dismiss a card on the spread of the player with the most life. (In the event of a tie, you choose which player.)
reversed: Reverse a card.

name: 9 of Swords
upright: The next time you would place a card, you may dismiss a card instead.
reversed: Reverse a card.

name: 10 of Swords
upright: Exchange a card on your spread with a card on another player's spread. (You may reverse those cards.)
reversed: Shuffle up to 3 cards from your memory into your deck.

name: Page of Swords
upright: Choose a number from 0 to 3. Each player draws that many cards. (Including you.)
reversed: For each player, silence a card on that player's spread. (The next time it would trigger, they do not.)

name: Knight of Swords
upright: The next time you place a card, you may trigger it immediately then silence it. (The next time it would trigger, it doesn't.)
reversed: Each player simultaneously chooses a number. Deal damage to each player equal to the number they chose. Dismiss a card on the spread of each player who chose the smallest number.

name: Queen of Swords
upright: Dismiss a card from each player's spread. (Including yours.)
reversed: Name a card. Cards with the chosen name do not trigger until your next turn.

name: King of Swords
upright: Dismiss all cards. (Including this one.)
reversed: You may dismiss any number of cards on your spread. Each opponent dismisses that many cards on their spread.

name: Ace of Wands
upright: Exile the top 3 cards of your deck face up. Until the end of this turn, whenever you place a card, you may place one of those cards instead.
reversed: Dismiss a card on your spread and place a card.

name: 2 of Wands
upright: Until the end of this turn, the next time a you would deal damage, deal double that damage instead. (This can stack.)
reversed: Place a card. The next time you would place a card, do not.

name: 3 of Wands
upright: Deal 2 damage to a player if this card is in the Past position, 3 damage if this card is in the Present position, or 4 damage if this card is in the Future position.
reversed: Dismiss a Minor card. Its player reveals the top card of their deck. If it’s a Minor card, they may place it in the same position.

name: 4 of Wands
upright: Dismiss this card, then place a card. Each player discards their hand then draws 3 cards.
reversed: You may reveal any number of cards in your hand. Deal 2 damage to a player for each Wand you reveal plus each Wand on your spread. (Including this one.)

name: 5 of Wands
upright: Deal 3 damage to a player. Flip this card face-down. (When you turn a silenced face-down card face-up, keep the silence counter on it and don't trigger it.)
reversed: Deal 1 damage to each opponent.

name: 6 of Wands
upright: Trigger another card on your spread. (Trigger the active effect.)
reversed: Silence a card on your spread. (The next time it would trigger, it doesn't.)

name: 7 of Wands
upright: Until your next turn, whenever a card on your spread is dismissed, deal 5 damage to any player.
reversed: Discard a card. If you do, deal 4 damage to a player.

name: 8 of Wands
upright: Deal 3 damage to a player, then replace this card with one from your hand or deck. (Dismiss this card. The new card does not trigger.)
reversed: Dismiss a card. Until your next turn, whenever its player would place a card, they may place that card instead.

name: 9 of Wands
upright: Deal damage to a player equal to the total number of damage you've dealt this turn, plus 1.
reversed: You may exile a card from your memory and return a card from your memory to your hand.

name: 10 of Wands
upright: Deal 3 damage to a player for each Cups card on their spread.
reversed: Deal 2 damage to a player for each Major card on their spread.

name: Page of Wands
upright: Exchange this card with another card. (You may reverse this card and the exchanged card.)
reversed: The next time you would place a card, you may deal 5 damage to any player instead.

name: Knight of Wands
upright: You may replace this card with one from your hand and trigger the new card. (Send this card to memory.)
reversed: Trigger another card on your spread twice, then silence that card. (The next time it would trigger, it doesn't.)

name: Queen of Wands
upright: Choose Wands, Cups, or Pentacles. Dismiss all cards of that suit. Dismiss this card.
reversed: Until your next turn, the next time you trigger a card, trigger it an additional time.

name: King of Wands
upright: Deal 3 damage to each opponent.
reversed: Exile the top 2 cards of your deck face-up. Until the end of this turn, whenever you would place a card, you may place one of those cards instead.

name: Ace of Cups
upright: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put it on the top or bottom of your deck. Draw a card.
reversed: You may place a card face-down. (Face-down cards may be flipped face-up and triggered at any time.)

name: 2 of Cups
upright: Draw a card for each Cup on your spread. You may reverse this card.
reversed: Deal damage to an opponent equal to the number of cards in your hand.

name: 3 of Cups
upright: Trigger each other card on your spread in any order. (Not including this one.)
reversed: Flip a card on your spread face-down. (Face-down cards may be flipped face-up and triggered at any time.)

name: 4 of Cups
upright: You may place a card face-down. (Face-down cards may be flipped face-up and triggered at any time.)
reversed: Return all cards on your spread to your hand. (Including this one.)

name: 5 of Cups
upright: Copy an effect that has triggered this turn.
reversed: You may shuffle your hand into your deck and draw that many cards.

name: 6 of Cups
upright: Restart the turn from the Past. Silence this card. (The next time it would trigger, it does not.)
reversed: Copy an effect of a card. (You may choose either effect on the card.)

name: 7 of Cups
upright: Choose 2 cards on the same spread. That player chooses a card from among those. Dismiss that card.
reversed: Deal damage to a player equal to the number of cards in your hand.

name: 8 of Cups
upright: For each opponent, choose a card on their spread. Return the chosen cards to their players' hands, then dismiss this card.
reversed: Flip a card on your spread face-down or place a card face-down. (Face-down cards may be turned face-up and triggered at any time.)

name: 9 of Cups
upright: You may end the turn and flip this card face-down. (When you flip a silenced face-down card face-up, keep the silence counter on it and don't trigger it.)
reversed: Copy an effect of a card. (You may choose either effect on the card.)

name: 10 of Cups
upright: You may reveal any number of cards in your hand. Draw a card for each Cup you reveal plus each Cup on your spread. (Including this one.)
reversed: Dismiss this card. Return all cards to their players' hands.

name: Page of Cups
upright: Each player reveals the top card of their deck. You may draw a card.
reversed: You may place a card face-down. (Face-down cards may be flipped face-up and triggered at any time.)

name: Knight of Cups
upright: Copy an effect of a card in your memory. (You may choose either effect on the card.)
reversed: Choose a player. That player puts 3 cards from their deck into their memory.

name: Queen of Cups
upright: Name a card. Until your next turn, cards with the chosen name cannot be dismissed, exiled, or placed.
reversed: Return any number of cards from your memory to your hand, then discard that many cards.

name: King of Cups
upright: Each player may draw a card. Until your next turn, each player who draws a card this way may not damage you or dismiss cards on your spread. ("Each player" includes you.)
reversed: Flip any number of cards on your spread face-down. (Face-down cards may be turned face-up and triggered at any time.)
